mining.rule

Class RuleMining

  • java.lang.Object
    • mining.rule.RuleMining

  • public class RuleMining
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Sandeep,Snehal,Poojitha AIM : To Use hash tree and come up with interesting association rules by using Apriori algorithm.

      • oneFrequentItemSet

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer>> oneFrequentItemSet(java.util.ArrayList<int[]> data,
                                                                                           DataRef dref,
                                                                                           double minSupport)
        Parameters:
        data - The data in the binary format
        dref - The class which stores the text corresponding to the the index value
        minSupport - The Support Threshold
        Returns:
        The ArrayList which contains all sets of 1-frequent items corresponding to the minimum Support Threshold

      • kminus1tok

        public static void kminus1tok(RuleMining ref,
                              java.util.ArrayList<java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer>> sets,
                              int k)
        Parameters:
        sets - All K-1 dimension sets
        k - Current cardinality of subsets This function takes in all the frequent k-1 subsets and generates the candidate k subsets. These candidates are then prepuned and passed to the HashTree class so that a tree can be formed out of these.

      • prepruning

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer>> prepruning(RuleMining ref,
                                                                                   java.util.ArrayList<java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer>> kfrequent,
                                                                                   int k)
        Parameters:
        ref - The object of class RuleMining
        kfrequent - The item sets of length K which are yet to be pruned further
        k - The length of item sets
        Returns:
        The set of K frequent item sets after removing sets which contain elements in which both stances for a particular cause has been taken. Also if it's k-1 subsets are not frequent then removed.

      • confidentRuleGen

        public static void confidentRuleGen(double minConf)
        Parameters:
        minConf - The Confidence threshold below which any rule would be pruned out for not having sufficient confidence This function checks confidence of only those rules who have the element 'democrat' or 'republican' in them. It passes such rules to the isConfRule() method

      • isConfRule

        public static void isConfRule(java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer> set,
                              double minConf)
        Parameters:
        set - The Rule in the set format whose confidence is to be tested
        minConf - The Confidence threshold below which any rule would be pruned out for not having sufficient confidence This function checks the confidence of each rule and adds only those rules to the global variable : confidentRules who have confidence more than the minimum threshold This function also prints all these rules in sentence format by referencing the DataRef Class
